bioghist.p: Founded in 1971, Philadelphia Dance Alliance is a non-profit, organization whose membership includes dance artists, dance students, dance companies, independent choreographers, university and college dance departments, dance studios and dance aficionados. They provide a variety of programs and services to professional dancers and students of dance. DanceLINK, founded in 1994, is a consortium of dance organizations from Chicago, Florida, Minnesota, and Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials from Philadelphia Dance Alliance. Records include: newsletters (1995-2002); membership directories; flyers and programs; and photographs. Independent Choreographers Exchange materials include: minutes of meetings, reviews, programs, flyers, and printed promotional material, and contracts. There are also records related to PDA's participation in the DanceLINK consortium. These records include: grant applications; written and recorded assessments of applicants; and audio and video tapes of performances. Other arts alliances that are represented in the collection include: Neighborhood Dance Exchange, Philadelphia Dances, and Dance Advance.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
